body_html:
@vi7us This screenshot is like inception of the Inception model :)

Ok, so it's failing on some devices with android.info.supportedHardwareLevel of 1, and some of 2 it seems. Unfortunate we can't use that as a discriminating factor.

A couple more questions:

  • What Android API levels are these devices?
  • If you hardcode the res to something like 640x480, does that help?

There is an older conversion of the demo from the Camera2 API to use the original android.hardware.Camera here: https://github.com/hamidb/tensorflow/blob/api20/tensorflow/examples/android/src/org/tensorflow/demo/CameraConnectionFragment.java

I feel this may address your problems -- if it does, contributions welcome to patch the demo to use android.hardware.Camera on lower API levels.

@vi7us This screenshot is like inception of the Inception model :)

Ok, so it's failing on some devices with android.info.supportedHardwareLevel of 1, and some of 2 it seems. Unfortunate we can't use that as a discriminating factor. 

A couple more questions:
- What Android API levels are these devices?
- If you hardcode the res to something like 640x480, does that help?

There is an older conversion of the demo from the Camera2 API to use the original android.hardware.Camera here: https://github.com/hamidb/tensorflow/blob/api20/tensorflow/examples/android/src/org/tensorflow/demo/CameraConnectionFragment.java

I feel this may address your problems -- if it does, contributions welcome to patch the demo to use android.hardware.Camera on lower API levels.
